Name: at
Description: Execute commands at a later time

Name: basename
Description: Return non-directory portion of a pathname; see also dirname

Name: batch
Description: Schedule commands to be executed in a batch queue

Name: cmp
Description: Compare two files; see also diff

Name: comm
Description: Select or reject lines common to two files

Name: cut
Description: Cut out selected fields of each line of a file

Name: cxref
Description: Generate a C-language program cross-reference table

Name: delta
Description: Make a delta (change) to an SCCS file

Name: diff
Description: Compare two files; see also cmp

Name: dirname
Description: Return the directory portion of a pathname; see also basename

Name: env
Description: Set the environment for command invocation

Name: fuser
Description: List process IDs of all processes that have one or more files open

Name: get
Description: Get a version of an SCCS file

Name: head
Description: Copy the first part of files

Name: ipcrm
Description: Remove a message queue, semaphore set, or shared memory segment identifier

Name: jobs
Description: Display status of jobs in the current session

Name: join
Description: Merges two sorted text files based on the presence of a common field

Name: link
Description: Create a hard link to a file

Name: make
Description: Maintain, update, and regenerate groups of programs

Name: more
Description: Display files on a page-by-page basis

Name: nice
Description: Invoke a utility with an altered nice value

Name: nm
Description: Write the name list of an object file

Name: nohup
Description: Invoke a utility immune to hangups

Name: paste
Description: Merge corresponding or subsequent lines of files

Name: read
Description: Read a line from standard input

Name: renice
Description: Set nice values of running processes

Name: rmdel
Description: Remove a delta from an SCCS file

Name: rmdir
Description: Remove directories, if they are empty.

Name: sccs
Description: Front end for the SCCS subsystem

Name: sh
Description: Shell, the standard command language interpreter
First appeared: Version 7 AT&T UNIX (in earlier versions, sh was either the Thompson shell or the PWB shell)

Name: sort
Description: Sort, merge, or sequence check text files

Name: strip
Description: Remove unnecessary information from executable files

Name: stty
Description: Set the options for a terminal

Name: tail
Description: Copy the last part of a file

Name: touch
Description: Change file access and modification times

Name: type
Description: Displays how a name would be interpreted if used as a command

Name: ulimit
Description: Set or report file size limit

Name: umask
Description: Get or set the file mode creation mask

Name: unget
Description: Undo a previous get of an SCCS file

Name: uniq
Description: Report or filter out repeated lines in a file

Name: uustat
Description: uucp status inquiry and job control

Name: wc
Description: Line, word and byte or character count

Name: who
Description: Display who is on the system

Name: xargs
Description: Construct argument lists and invoke utility
